title: Life Science HiSET.S.3.1 (Q15)
prompt: What hypothesis might the scientist decide to test?
feedback: The correct answer is: “Plant species with large variation in meristematic cell size are less quick to grow back when trimmed.” A hypothesis is an idea, based on observation, that a scientist can test with an experiment. This idea can be tested. The variation in meristematic cell size is data that the scientist already collected. The idea that meristematic cells vary in size is also shown from the data the scientist has. It could be a conclusion from the data, but it’s not a hypothesis the scientist might test. The idea that every meristematic stem cell has a measureable length is also not a hypothesis.
